016package app.supernaut.fx;
017
018import app.supernaut.fx.test.NoopBackgroundApp;
019import javafx.application.Application;
020import app.supernaut.BackgroundApp;
021import app.supernaut.ForegroundApp;
022import app.supernaut.Launcher;
023import app.supernaut.fx.internal.OpenJfxProxyApplication;
024import org.slf4j.Logger;
025import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
026
027import java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException;
028import java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture;
029import java.util.concurrent.CountDownLatch;
030import java.util.function.Supplier;
031
032/**
033 * Base JavaFX implementation of {@link FxLauncher}. This implementation provides the following functionality:
034 * <ol>
035 *     <li>
036 *      Starts OpenJFX applications.
037 *     </li>
038 *     <li>
039 *      Constructor provides an option to start {@link BackgroundApp} on a new thread (this allows
040 *      the {@code BackgroundApp} and the OpenJFX {@link FxForegroundApp} to initialize in parallel.)
041 *     </li>
042 *     <li>
043 *      Implements {@link Launcher#launchAsync} which initializes the OpenJFX {@link FxForegroundApp} on
044 *      a new thread. This is not needed for a typical, packaged OpenJFX application
045 *      which can just call {@link Launcher#launch} from its {@code static main()}, but is useful
046 *      in various testing scenarios.
047 *     </li>
048 *     <li>
049 *      Defines the {@link AppFactory} interface for constructing the {@link BackgroundApp} and {@link FxForegroundApp}.
050 *      This allows subclasses (or callers) to provide their own implementation of the application creation logic. The
051 *      AppFactory interface was designed to allow usage of Dependency Injection frameworks like <b>Micronaut</b>
052 *      to create dependency-injected implementations of {@link FxForegroundApp} and {@link BackgroundApp}. The {@link AppFactory AppFactory}
053 *      interface was also designed to be lazily-instantiated so the {@link AppFactory AppFactory} (dependency-injection framework)
054 *      can initialize in parallel to OpenJFX.
055 *     </li>
056 *     <li>
057 *      Uses the same {@link AppFactory AppFactory} (dependency-injection context) to initialize the Foreground and Background
058 *      applications. A {@code CountDownLatch} is used to make sure the {@link AppFactory AppFactory} (which may be initialized
059 *      on another thread along with the BackgroundApp) is ready when {@link OpenJfxProxyApplication} calls
060 *      {@code createForegroundApp(Application proxyApplication)}.
061 *     </li>
062 * </ol>
063 *
064 */
065public abstract class FxLauncherAbstract implements FxLauncher {
066    private static final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(FxLauncherAbstract.class);
067    private static final String backgroundAppLauncherThreadName = "SupernautFX-Background-Launcher";
068    private static final String foregroundAppLauncherThreadName = "SupernautFX-JavaFX-Launcher";
069
070    private final boolean initializeBackgroundAppOnNewThread;
071    private final Supplier<AppFactory> appFactorySupplier;
072    private final CountDownLatch appFactoryInitializedLatch;
073    private AppFactory appFactory;
074
075    /** This future returns an initialized BackgroundApp */
076    protected final CompletableFuture<BackgroundApp> futureBackgroundApp = new CompletableFuture<>();
077    /** This future returns an initialized ForegroundApp */
078    protected final CompletableFuture<ForegroundApp> futureForegroundApp = new CompletableFuture<>();
079
080    /* Temporary storage of foregroundAppClass for interaction with OpenJfxProxyApplication */
081    private Class<? extends FxForegroundApp> foregroundAppClass;
082
083    /**
084     * Interface that can be used to create and pre-initialize {@link ForegroundApp} and {@link BackgroundApp}.
085     * This interface can be implemented by subclasses (or direct callers of the constructor.) By "pre-initialize" we
086     * mean call implementation-dependent methods prior to {@code init()} or {@code start()}.
087     * This interface is designed to support using Dependency Injection frameworks like Micronaut, see
088     * {@code MicronautSfxLauncher}.
089     */
090    public interface AppFactory {
091        /**
092         * Create the background class instance from a {@link Class} object
093         * @param backgroundAppClass the class to create
094         * @return application instance
095         */
096        BackgroundApp   createBackgroundApp(Class<? extends BackgroundApp> backgroundAppClass);
097
098        /**
099         * Create the background class instance from a {@link Class} object
100         * @param foregroundAppClass  the class to create
101         * @param proxyApplication a reference to the proxy {@link Application} created by Supernaut.FX
102         * @return application instance
103         */
104        FxForegroundApp createForegroundApp(Class<? extends FxForegroundApp> foregroundAppClass, Application proxyApplication);
105    }
106
107    /**
108     * Default implementation of AppFactory.
109     */
110    public static class DefaultAppFactory implements AppFactory {
111        
112        @Override
113        public BackgroundApp createBackgroundApp(Class<? extends BackgroundApp> backgroundAppClass) {
114            return newInstance(backgroundAppClass);
115        }
116
117        @Override
118        public FxForegroundApp createForegroundApp(Class<? extends FxForegroundApp> foregroundAppClass, Application proxyApplication) {
119            return newInstance(foregroundAppClass);
120        }
121
122        /**
123         * newInstance without checked exceptions.
124         *
125         * @param clazz A Class object that must have a no-args constructor.
126         * @param <T> The type of the class
127         * @return A new instanceof the class
128         * @throws RuntimeException exceptions thrown by {@code newInstance()}.
129         */
130        private static <T> T newInstance(Class<T> clazz) {
131            T foregroundApp;
132            try {
133                foregroundApp = clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
134            } catch (NoSuchMethodException | InstantiationException | IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException e) {
135                throw new RuntimeException(e);
136            }
137            return foregroundApp;
138        }
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Construct an Asynchronous Launcher that works with OpenJFX.
143     * 
144     * @param appFactorySupplier A Supplier that will lazily instantiate an AppFactory.
145     * @param initializeBackgroundAppOnNewThread If true, initializes {@code appFactorySupplier} and
146     *        {@code BackgroundApp} on new thread, if false start them on calling thread (typically the main thread)
147     */
148    public FxLauncherAbstract(Supplier<AppFactory> appFactorySupplier, boolean initializeBackgroundAppOnNewThread) {
149        this.appFactorySupplier = appFactorySupplier;
150        this.initializeBackgroundAppOnNewThread = initializeBackgroundAppOnNewThread;
151        appFactoryInitializedLatch = new CountDownLatch(1);
152    }
153
154    /**
155     * {@inheritDoc}
156     */
157    @Override
158    public CompletableFuture<ForegroundApp> launchAsync(String[] args, Class<? extends ForegroundApp> foregroundAppClass, Class<? extends BackgroundApp> backgroundApp) {
159        log.info("launchAsync...");
160        launchInternal(args, foregroundAppClass, backgroundApp, true);
161        return getForegroundApp();
162    }
163
164    /**
165     * {@inheritDoc}
166     */
167    @Override
168    public void launch(String[] args, Class<? extends ForegroundApp> foregroundAppClass, Class<? extends BackgroundApp> backgroundApp) {
169        log.info("launch...");
170        launchInternal(args, foregroundAppClass, backgroundApp, false);
171    }
172
173    /**
174     * {@inheritDoc}
175     */
176    @Override
177    public void launch(String[] args, Class<? extends ForegroundApp> foregroundAppClass) {
178        launch(args, foregroundAppClass, NoopBackgroundApp.class);
179    }
180
181    /**
182     * Called by {@code OpenJfxProxyApplication} to create its delegate {@link FxForegroundApp} object.
183     * Waits on a {@link CountDownLatch} to make sure the {@link AppFactory AppFactory} is ready.
184     * 
185     * @param proxyApplication The calling instance of {@code OpenJfxProxyApplication}
186     * @return The newly constructed OpenJFX-compatible {@link FxForegroundApp}
187     */
188    @Override
189    public FxForegroundApp createForegroundApp(Application proxyApplication) {
190        try {
191            appFactoryInitializedLatch.await();
192        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
193            throw new RuntimeException(e);
194        }
195        FxForegroundApp foregroundApp = appFactory.createForegroundApp(foregroundAppClass, proxyApplication);
196        if (foregroundApp instanceof FxForegroundApp.OpenJfxApplicationAware) {
197            // If foregroundApp implements the interface, pass it the JfxApplication implementation
198            ((FxForegroundApp.OpenJfxApplicationAware) foregroundApp).setJfxApplication(proxyApplication);
199        }
200        // TODO: Create a LauncherAware interface for injecting the launcher into apps?
201        futureForegroundApp.complete(foregroundApp);
202        return foregroundApp;
203    }
204
205    /**
206     * {@inheritDoc}
207     */
208    @Override
209    public CompletableFuture<ForegroundApp> getForegroundApp() {
210        return futureForegroundApp;
211    }
212
213    /**
214     * {@inheritDoc}
215     */
216    @Override
217    public CompletableFuture<BackgroundApp> getBackgroundApp() {
218        return futureBackgroundApp;
219    }
220
221    /**
222     * Internal launch method called by both {@code launchAsync()} and {@code launch()}
223     * @param args Command-line arguments to pass to the Foreground (OpenJFX) application
224     * @param initForegroundOnNewThread If true, start OpenJFX on a new thread, if false start it on
225     *                        calling thead (typically this will be the main thread)
226     */
227    private void launchInternal(String[] args, Class<? extends ForegroundApp> foregroundAppClass, Class<? extends BackgroundApp> backgroundAppClass, boolean initForegroundOnNewThread) {
228        launchBackgroundApp(backgroundAppClass);
229        launchForegroundApp(args, castFxForegroundApp(foregroundAppClass), initForegroundOnNewThread);
230    }
231
232    /**
233     * Cast {@link ForegroundApp} to {@link FxForegroundApp}
234     *
235     * @param foregroundAppClass A {@link ForegroundApp} implementation that is expected to be an implementation of {@code FxForegroundApp}
236     * @throws IllegalArgumentException if foregroundAppClass doesn't implement {@code FxForegroundApp}
237     * @return The passed in reference, but cast to {@link FxForegroundApp}
238     */
239    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
240    private Class<? extends FxForegroundApp> castFxForegroundApp(Class<? extends ForegroundApp> foregroundAppClass) {
241        if (!FxForegroundApp.class.isAssignableFrom(foregroundAppClass)) {
242            throw new IllegalArgumentException("foregroundAppClass must be an implementation of FxForegroundApp");
243        }
244        return (Class<? extends FxForegroundApp>) foregroundAppClass;
245    }
246
247    private void launchBackgroundApp(Class<? extends BackgroundApp> backgroundAppClass) {
248        if (initializeBackgroundAppOnNewThread) {
249            log.info("Launching background app on {} thread", backgroundAppLauncherThreadName);
250            startThread(backgroundAppLauncherThreadName,  () -> startBackgroundApp(backgroundAppClass));
251        } else {
252            log.info("Launching background app on caller's thread");
253            startBackgroundApp(backgroundAppClass);
254        }
255    }
256
257    private void launchForegroundApp(String[] args, Class<? extends FxForegroundApp> foregroundAppClass, boolean async) {
258        if (async) {
259            log.info("Launching on {} thread", foregroundAppLauncherThreadName);
260            startThread(foregroundAppLauncherThreadName, () -> startForegroundApp(args, foregroundAppClass));
261        } else {
262            log.info("Launching on caller's thread");
263            startForegroundApp(args, foregroundAppClass);
264        }
265    }
266
267    private void startBackgroundApp(Class<? extends BackgroundApp> backgroundAppClass) {
268        log.info("Instantiating appFactory");
269        this.appFactory = appFactorySupplier.get();
270
271        /*
272         * Tell the foreground app thread that appFactory is initialized.
273         */
274        log.info("Release appFactoryInitializedLatch");
275        appFactoryInitializedLatch.countDown();
276
277        log.info("Instantiating backgroundApp class");
278        BackgroundApp backgroundApp = appFactory.createBackgroundApp(backgroundAppClass);
279
280        /*
281         * Do any (hopefully minimal) background initialization that
282         * is needed before starting the foreground
283         */
284        log.info("Init backgroundApp");
285        backgroundApp.init();
286
287        futureBackgroundApp.complete(backgroundApp);
288
289
290        /*
291         * Call the background app, so it can start its own threads
292         */
293        backgroundApp.start();
294    }
295    
296    private void startForegroundApp(String[] args, Class<? extends FxForegroundApp> foregroundAppClass) {
297        OpenJfxProxyApplication.configuredLauncher = this;
298        this.foregroundAppClass = foregroundAppClass;
299        log.info("Calling Application.launch()");
300        Application.launch(OpenJfxProxyApplication.class, args);
301        log.info("OpenJfxProxyApplication exited.");
302    }
303
304    private Thread startThread(String threadName, Runnable target) {
305        Thread thread = new Thread(target);
306        thread.setName(threadName);
307        thread.start();
308        return thread;
309    }
310}
